The system utilizes a quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the machine width to produce a linear plane of filaments with uniform distribution. By controlling parameters such as quench air temperature, air flow rate, and slot opening, the system allows for easy adjustment of filament denier. The resulting nonwoven webs have improved uniformity, isotropicity, and web formation control compared to conventional systems. </summary>

<summary> The source document describes a sewing machine system that allows users to easily specify a sewing position on a work cloth using an ultrasonic pen. The system includes receivers on the sewing machine or embroidery unit to detect ultrasonic waves transmitted from the pen. The system calculates the specified coordinates based on the detection timings of the receivers and the sonic velocity. The ultrasonic pen may transmit an electromagnetic wave signal to notify the sewing machine of the transmission timing. The system can accurately identify the specified position and start sewing on the work cloth. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials by applying functional additives. Wool particles or wool powder are used as carriers for functional additives, demonstrating exceptional carrying and retention ability. Additionally, a preparation comprising bamboo fiber as a functional additive is described. Methods for preparing these preparations involve pulverizing wool or bamboo fiber into ultrafine powder and forming suspensions with binding agents. The preparations are applied to fabric materials through printing, padding, or foam application methods. The treated fabrics show improved ultraviolet protection, moisture management, wicking properties, and wrinkle recovery. Furthermore, the preparations enhance the anti-bacterial properties of the fabrics. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is an automatic quilting machine with separate computers controlling the sewing machine functions and the frame table movement, allowing for independent reprogramming of each function. The machine includes a computer aided design program for creating and duplicating sewing patterns, simplifying the process of programming and modifying patterns. By segregating the control of sewing functions and table movement, the invention increases efficiency and accuracy in quilting large fabrics such as bedspreads and quilts. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image, using hydroentanglement. The fabric is made by providing two precursor webs with different fibrous matrices and a fluid-pervious support layer between them. The precursor webs are hydroentangled on a moveable imaging surface with a three-dimensional image transfer device. The resulting fabric exhibits a pronounced image on both sides and can be used in various consumer applications. The method allows for the incorporation of apertures and different fiber compositions in the fabric, providing improved resiliency and durability. The fabric can be used in products like hygiene articles, medical gauze, wipes, protective wear, and apparel. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a knitting method and knit fabric for linking rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garments, such as sweaters and tank tops, without the need for separate sewing processes, increasing productivity and reducing manufacturing costs. The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces on a flat knitting machine, transferring loops between the pieces, and gradually binding off the overlaid loops to join the end portions seamlessly. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, ensuring continuous operation and insensitivity to disturbances. The device includes a stop in the feed path of the strip controlled by a lever and air cylinder, with a sequence control for starting and stopping the sewing machine based on the position of the stop and the strip material. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a flexible traction element for lifts, comprising stranded cables sheathed in a flexible thermoplastic material. A production line embeds the cables in the material, ensuring precise orientation and adhesion. The method involves preheating the cables, sheathing them in the extruder with the material, and ensuring long-term adhesion. The traction elements are versatile and suitable for lifting and pulling loads, meeting high safety requirements. The production line includes various components such as cleaning systems, extruders, and cooling troughs to ensure high-quality traction elements. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, designed to minimize hindrance to the guiding of the needle thread loop. The arrangement includes cams, a spring rod, and a capsule release device to facilitate smooth movement of the needle thread loop around the bobbin housing. By strategically placing holding means on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, the needle thread loop can be expanded and pulled back without significant impediment. The design allows for jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop, improving sewing properties of the rotary hook arrangement. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a sewing machine detector that detects the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine using light transmission through optical fibers and reflecting discs. The detector reduces stress on the optical fibers, provides accurate detection signals, and includes a power indicating light that does not interfere with the sewing machine control circuitry. </summary>

<summary> The invention involves the production of silicon-based nanowires and films using liquid silane inks through electrospinning. Different compositions of inks were used, including three-component inks with Si 6 H 12 and PMMA, and five-component inks with additional solid phases like metal particles or quantum dots. The resulting nanowires were transformed through thermal or laser processing to produce amorphous or crystalline silicon materials. These materials were then coated with conductive carbon and used to create composite materials, such as anodes for lithium-ion batteries, demonstrating the versatility and potential applications of the invention. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel using fluid pressure-sensitive biasing arrangements connected to tensioning levers. The tensioning lever, with a roller engaging the threads, adjusts its position based on thread tension and weight. The system allows for individual and centralized control of thread tension, with the ability to quickly increase braking force when the warping machine is shut off. An alternate embodiment replaces the friction brake with an electromagnetic brake for more precise control of braking force. </summary>

<summary> The invention describes a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness, achieved through specific treatments including completion of coagulation and washing with water of non-alkaline pH. The process results in yarn with a high degree of whiteness, mechanical characteristics, and reduced treatment steps compared to traditional methods. </summary>

<summary> The invention addresses the issue of oxygen entrained in pulp during the bleaching process, causing foam and reducing vacuum in the washer. Existing deaeration systems are costly and involve large equipment. The inventors developed a small deaeration tank with no moving parts, utilizing filtrate from the washer to swirl the pulp for optimal deaeration. The tank is cylindrical, with an inlet pipe and outlet strategically placed for efficient deaeration. The system also includes sensors to control pulp consistency and flow, ensuring effective deaeration before washing. The design allows for recovery of steam or oxygen, making the process more efficient and cost-effective. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. Traditional composite structures mimic metallic structures, but composite materials offer tailored properties for high structural performance. The function-oriented material design (FOMD) process, using topology optimization, helps design advanced materials with unprecedented properties. The BTR composite structure includes stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels with curved shapes for different applications. The tendon elements can be made of various materials, and the structure can be optimized for specific functions and loading conditions. The BTR concept can be extended to three-dimensional configurations and used in various applications, such as composite armor. Overall, the BTR composite offers a new approach to material design for improved structural performance. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames in structures to dissipate energy during dynamic events. The device may undergo plastic deformation to limit loads and can be easily replaced after deformation. The device is designed to prevent extensive damage to structures during seismic events and can be used in various applications such as buildings, vehicles, and bridges. Different geometries of the device can be used for different bracing configurations in structures. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a unit type bedroom cabinet designed for flophouse facilities. The bedroom cabinet is assembled in a box shape with an outer casing and an inner casing. The outer casing is formed by upper and lower outer casings with flanges for assembly. The inner casing includes panels for shelves, boxes for devices, and a mat. Spacer members with vent grooves are interposed between the outer and inner casings for ventilation and sound-proofing. The design allows for efficient use of space, easy assembly, and customization for various devices. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a portable guard rail support for construction sites, providing a safe work area for workers at dangerous heights. The guard rail support includes a base plate, upright column, rail supporting brackets, kick board retaining flange, angular brace, and safety tie-off ring. A concrete-filled steel base is also provided for stability when anchoring to the floor is not possible. The guard rail support can be used to construct safety barriers with wooden rails or mesh-like fences, meeting safety regulations and providing easy installation and removal. The system reduces liability by preventing damage to lumber and ensuring durability for long-term use in various construction environments. </summary>

<summary> The disclosure describes a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures, allowing for the coupling of grid-strips to create a composite soil reinforcing element. The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to secure transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip, preventing lateral movement and providing additional tensile strength to the vertical facing. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a plow blade design with fluid passage and ejection points for efficient production. The blade construction allows for rebuilding and replacing worn parts. The method of ejecting fluid at specific points along the blade reduces friction and drag during plowing. Different embodiments show variations in fluid tube placement and flow paths to optimize fluid injection for specific job requirements. The design allows for easy customization and modification without welding, using traditional manufacturing processes. Overall, the invention provides a cost-effective and efficient solution for plowing utilities with reduced power requirements. </summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to the stimulation of crude oil reservoirs using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods. The method involves generating acoustic and electromagnetic-acoustic vibrations to enhance oil flow and increase oil recovery. Different categories of methods are discussed, including electrical, heating, mechanical fracturing, and acoustic methods. The invention extends the effective range of stimulation by using multiple sources in multiple wells and customizing discharge characteristics for optimal stimulation. Additionally, the invention includes methods for separating components of the recovered fluids, such as hydrocarbons, gases, water, and impurities. Various separation techniques, including membrane processes, fractionation, cryogenic separation, and solvent extraction, are discussed for separating components like CO2, H2S, heavy metals, and gases from the recovered fluids. The invention also addresses electrode wear in electrohydraulic devices and includes improvements for electrode longevity. Overall, the invention provides a comprehensive approach to enhancing oil recovery and processing recovered fluids from oil reservoirs.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a safe with a door structure that allows for secure locking and protection against intrusion attempts. The safe can be constructed with a liner and concrete, or as a preassembled steel safe, providing a simple and effective design for securing valuables. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a building system for stucco type cavity wall construction, allowing for panels larger than 2.4 meters in height and 4 meters in width without movement joints. The system includes battens, mesh reinforcement, plaster matrix, and various flashings for openings. The method involves fixing battens to the support structure, attaching inner mesh, applying plaster in multiple layers, and embedding additional reinforcement as required. The system meets building code requirements for structural integrity, durability, fire resistance, and external moisture protection. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method for accurately measuring fluid pressures in geological formations at desired depths. The method involves placing a pressure transducer and filter in a borehole, filling the borehole with cement grout, and then displacing the grout around the filter to create a fluid connection to the formation. A fluid is injected to fracture the formation and allow formation fluid to flow to the pressure transducer. The system isolates the pressure transducer from other borehole pressures, ensuring accurate measurement of formation pressures. Different embodiments of the system allow for flexibility in sensor placement and monitoring of formation pressures. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an enclosed floor track system for transporting hand trucks in a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the environment. The system prevents brine solution from coming into contact with the hand truck wheels, allowing for the recovery and reuse of the solution. Two embodiments of the system are described, one for horizontally axled hand trucks and another for hand trucks with downwardly depending struts. The system includes wheel channels with cover plates and inflatable seals to prevent contamination. The enclosed tracks are supported above the chamber floor and are inclined to drain washing fluids. The system enhances the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, preserving natural resources and providing an economic advantage. The invention allows for the segregation of the hand truck wheel structure from the chamber environment, maintaining a sanitary condition for the brine solution. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function and a method of mounting an elastic member. It aims to prevent tire fall-in and stuck-in situations, especially in new transit systems and road bridges. The structure includes steps with elastic members, a joint block, and supporting blocks to absorb bridge girder expansion or contraction. By using laminated rubber and concrete components, the structure ensures high slip resistance, reduces tire issues, and allows for easy maintenance. The method involves joining elastic members, fixing them in place, and deforming them to accommodate bridge girder changes caused by temperature. Overall, the invention provides a safe and smooth vehicle traveling experience.</summary>

<summary> The lock device of the present invention prevents a work machine from tilting by locking the boom to the main body using an engaging member and an engaged member. The lock device is easy to operate manually and prevents damage to the members by providing guide members and a slip-prevention plate. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil well drilling tools, providing a retriever section that can be mounted onto a drill string independently of threading on the pipe. The apparatus allows for vertical movement of the retriever unit while preventing rotational movement, ensuring successful retrieval of the wear bushing without damage. An additional embodiment includes a retriever section with a threaded end for engaging with a threaded wear bushing, offering an alternative method for retrieval. </summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to precast concrete retaining walls for use alongside highways and railways. Traditional retaining wall designs focus on pressure at the base, limiting wall height. The invention allows for taller walls with shorter bases by pre-manufacturing components. The system consists of a face panel with integral counterfort and a solid base, connected with rebar and grout. Additional features include drainage openings, shear keys, and options for stability enhancements like H-piles or impact barriers. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a vibratory tool for downhole use that allows for the passage of a wireline or other tools through a central passage that can be closed by landing a plug on a seat. The tool features modular stacked piston units to increase power delivery, an annular dump valve to prevent slamming against a seat, and a simple plug for activation. The valve opens and closes without impacts, allowing for longer trouble-free service. The tool can be operated with or without impacts on each cycle, depending on the applied overpull force. The design eliminates the need for critical tool components to be delivered as part of a dart assembly, making the components more robust and reliable. The tool can be used for fishing operations, stimulation, and providing large amplitude vibrations in a tubing string. Overall, the tool offers improved reliability, power delivery, and ease of operation compared to prior designs.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to systems and methods for delivering heat at the down hole end of oil or gas wells to improve production. The system focuses heat in the production zone and protects electrical components from damage, resulting in increased flow rates. The design includes a heating unit with insulated electrical connections, heat insulating packers, and stainless steel collars to contain and focus heat where needed. The method involves using the system to treat wells with high viscosity or paraffin blockages, providing a more effective and reliable solution compared to existing technologies. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with an adjustable central vacuum portion for regulating suction efficiency. The device allows for real-time adjustment of suction pressure without needing to adjust the suction source. It includes adjustment mechanisms on the top of the vacuum head for precise regulation of suction, and can be easily added to existing pool cleaning devices. The invention provides a simple, cost-effective, and easy-to-use solution for regulating suction in swimming pool vacuum cleaners. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including those that are stuck or lost. It includes an external pull tool or overshot and an internal pull tool or spear, both with a catch mechanism for locking and unlocking. The mechanism allows for controlled connection and disconnection with down hole objects without the need for jarring or mechanical shocks. The overshot mechanism includes a latching control element and guide pins for latching and unlatching the collet structure. The mechanism can be used for various down hole service operations, such as fishing for stuck tools in well bores. The latching and unlatching cycles can be repeated indefinitely without the need for resetting. The invention provides a simple and efficient way to handle objects in wells, improving the efficiency of well servicing operations. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to ladder attachments that provide lateral stability, prevent damage to work surfaces, and allow the ladder to straddle corners. The attachments include large contact area braces with resilient pads and U-bolts to secure the ladder rungs. The design improves ladder safety, stability, and versatility for various work surfaces. </summary>

<summary> The example embodiment relates to a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with improved durability. The method involves using a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm. Multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, glue, and clamps, are used to assemble the substrates. The goal is to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the floors and prevent deformation. The improved floors have a longer lifespan and allow for corrective maintenance. The use of specific glazes further enhances the durability of the floors. Overall, the example embodiment provides a solution to the drawbacks of conventional composed stave floors, offering increased durability and maintenance capabilities. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a position sensor system that multiplexes multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with minimal energy consumption. The system includes a waveform generator, error correction generator, and sensor monitoring equipment, providing a method for eliminating static signals and noise from the sensor output. By constantly comparing the sensor output to a desired minimum value and generating error correction signals, the system ensures accurate position sensing with minimal power consumption. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, providing increased adhesion and reducing debris generation during driving. The collation system includes collar portions that encircle the fastener shanks and connecting portions between adjacent collars. Various configurations, such as tapered collars, embossed patterns, and preferentially weakened regions, are used to influence separation of the connecting portions at desired locations. The collation system also includes features such as thin bridges, stiff ribs, and deformations on the nail shanks to enhance penetration into the substrate and reduce debris. Overall, the collation system aims to minimize debris generation, increase holding power, and provide structural integrity during fastener driving.</summary>

<summary> The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants in various industries such as aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. It consists of a bell-shaped tip and an injection button for precise sealant application. The design allows for encapsulation of rivets and nuts, providing a strong and non-permanent connection. The injection button has channels and orifices for accurate sealing operations. The device can be used manually or with injection machines, improving efficiency and quality of sealant application. The design also allows for easy transition to applying sealing cords or filler sealants after sealing operations. Overall, the invention simplifies the sealing process, saves time and labor, and enhances the quality of sealant application. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust functions in internal combustion engines, offering variable valve displacement without the need for springs. The system allows for precise control of valve port opening, potentially reducing gas consumption and enhancing engine performance. The system can be applied to engines with multiple valves per cylinder, providing a simple, robust, and efficient solution for controlling valve actuation. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, with a light member having a housing, lighting control region, and switch for controlling different colors of light. The light member can also be used under cabinets, with modules that emit different colors of light and can be controlled remotely or with timers. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures. The apparatus includes separate inserts for separating walls, which are inserted into the machine after casting. This design eliminates the disadvantages of cast separating walls, such as thermal stresses and high weight. The inserts can be made of metal or non-metal materials and are secured in place using holders integrated into the machine. The cooling fluid flows through the channels in opposite directions, deflected by U-shaped separating walls. The invention simplifies assembly, reduces weight, and allows for easy adjustment of the cooling system. The approach is particularly beneficial for gas turbine blades, improving efficiency and reducing production complexity.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, allowing for smooth switching between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch or stall. The system includes a control unit that processes signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve to set the throttle position for optimal performance, and can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission for optimal control.</summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels like wood waste. Conventional hog fuel burners have been inefficient and polluting, requiring frequent cleaning and maintenance. The waste fuel burner described in the document aims to emit minimal particulate materials within environmental regulations. It can effectively burn wet wood with high moisture content and produce little slag or clinkers. The burner operates by forming a conical pile of waste fuel, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile, drying and gasifying the fuel. The volatile gases are partially oxidized in a primary combustion chamber with swirl air, then complete combustion occurs in a secondary chamber with tangentially introduced air. The burner is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to changes in load. It can burn fuels with varying moisture content and types, producing clean exhaust gases suitable for various industrial applications. The control system for the burner adjusts air and fuel flow rates based on heat demand, temperature measurements, and oxygen levels to optimize combustion efficiency and minimize emissions.</summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to evaporative refrigeration in the field of air conditioning. The system uses a heat exchanger to cool air without adding water vapor. It recirculates return air from the load for efficient cooling. The system can achieve high efficiency by using fresh air on the dry side and return air on the wet side. A hybrid system combines evaporative cooling with vapor compression refrigeration for further dehumidification. The system is energy-efficient and can achieve significant reductions in energy consumption compared to traditional refrigeration units. Overall, the system provides a highly efficient and effective method for cooling air. </summary>

<summary> The document describes a fluid pump with multiple pump heads arranged in series to pump fluid from a reservoir. Each pump head contains an impeller driven by a drive structure passing through the pump heads. The fluid flows through conduits in each pump head and is combined into a single flow before exiting. The pump heads are connected by combiners, and the drive structure commonly drives all impellers. The pump can be mounted on a support structure like a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer for operation at a fluid reservoir. The design allows for modularity and ease of maintenance, with the ability to add more pump heads for increased operating pressure. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine and an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads such as blade-off events. The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin to selectively retain the links, allowing translation and damping of extreme shocks. The pin serves as a fusible link that shears under extreme loads, preventing damage to the gearbox and attached peripherals. The radial interface between the male and female links provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy during translation, reducing the need for all linkages to withstand extreme loads. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to archery equipment, specifically apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and balancing arrow shafts. The invention includes a point cap system for adjustable weight, a balance pin for balancing arrow shafts, and means for attaching points without allowing dirt to enter the shaft. The invention also includes a point adaptor, a nock cap adaptor, and a method for uniformly capping the end of an arrow shaft. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders, reducing excess components and improving engine robustness. The engine includes an engine housing with a plurality of cylinders, each having a movable piston and connected to hydraulically and mechanically actuated devices. A portion of the cylinders have engine compression release brakes connected to the exhaust valve for engine braking. The engine brake system includes a solenoid, valve members, and a piston to control the opening and closing of the exhaust valve during engine braking. The operation of the engine brake is controlled by an electronic control module, determining when engine braking is needed and activating the brake for the desired braking horsepower. The modular design allows for flexibility in choosing the number of engine brakes based on the required braking horsepower, providing a cost-effective solution for different applications. The invention offers various modifications and orientations for the engine brake system, allowing for customization and optimization based on specific engine requirements. Overall, the invention provides a versatile and efficient engine compression release brake system for improved engine performance.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an air intake device for internal combustion engines that utilizes the dynamic effects of air flow to improve engine performance while reducing noise. The device includes a tank, two pipes of different sizes interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage, and a valve with an actuator responsive to engine operating conditions. The smaller pipe acts as a resonator to absorb intake noise, while the valve operation is optimized based on engine speed and load. The valve is closed at lower engine speeds and loads, and opened at higher speeds and loads to improve engine performance. The control circuit produces a control signal for the valve based on input from engine speed and throttle position sensors. </summary>

<summary> The invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training. It provides a cost-effective and realistic simulation of small arms fire without modifying the weapon. The simulator utilizes a plastic expendable housing metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic charges and an electrical ignition system. The circuitry includes various functional blocks such as bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillators, firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, firing sensors, and MILES interface. The simulator is designed to resemble a magazine clip of an M16 rifle and contains a plastic expendable with pyrotechnic charges. The pyrotechnic charges are ignited by heating a bridge wire, producing combustion by-products that simulate small arms fire. The invention provides a reliable, low maintenance, and reusable small arms training device. The detailed description includes the block diagram of the electrical control circuit, schematic diagram, and illustrations of the expendable and firing unit. The simulator is designed for training combat troops with an M16 rifle and MILES unit attached. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a two-part bracket for mounting speakers or equipment to various surfaces. It allows for easy installation by one person and can be used on poles, walls, or other structures. The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket that can be easily connected together. The adjustable bracket allows for directional positioning of the mounted object. For pole mounting, adapters and a clamp assembly are used to securely attach the bracket to the pole. A speaker mounting bracket can be attached to the adjustable bracket for mounting speakers. The entire assembly provides a simple and efficient way to mount objects securely to different surfaces. </summary>

<summary> The invention focuses on improving fuel economy and durability of rotary internal combustion engines by enhancing the water cooling system. The use of in-line or dual spark plugs for a single rotor housing is a design aspect that has gained commercial acceptance. The staggered arrangement of spark plug bosses in the cooling passageway improves coolant flow and heat transfer, reducing the risk of structural failure. By offsetting the spark plug terminals and arranging the bosses symmetrically, the combustion flame propagation is not affected while ensuring efficient cooling. Tests have shown that the staggered configuration of spark plug bosses increases the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44% compared to the traditional in-line arrangement. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing by using control valve positions as feedback. The method maintains total mass flow through parallel control valves constant to minimize steam boiler pressure changes and turbine power changes. The flow compensation is determined based on the valve position and is applied to the remaining control valves when one valve is closed for testing. The method was tested on a simulated turbine system and showed a significant reduction in pressure excursions during valve testing. The invention provides an effective solution to minimize flow disturbance during turbine control valve testing. </summary>

<summary> The present disclosure relates to a burner for heat utilizing appliances, with a focus on optimizing efficiency and limiting unburned fuel emissions. The burner includes a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, with air flowing through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and around the fuel holder to support secondary combustion. A shroud surrounds the outer wall to establish a flow path for tertiary combustion air. The burner also features legs for support, a pivotally coupled ash pan, a perforate food grate, and a cover for closing the combustion chamber. Additionally, the burner includes manual couplings for attaching modular heat utilizing appliances, such as closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. The system allows for interchangeable or modular heat utilizing appliances to be coupled to the burner, providing versatility and efficiency in various applications.</summary>

<summary> The invention is a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that allows for continuous adjustment of the mixture of soap solution and water, ranging from 0% soap solution to 100% soap solution. The valve system maintains constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages and allows for multiple users to operate from a common soap solution source and water source without affecting the pressure required by each user. </summary>

<summary> The document discusses the use of cooling fans to prevent overheating of electronic components in various applications. It introduces a system for eliminating fasteners traditionally used to secure cooling fans to enclosures, reducing costs and labor. The system involves mounting the cooling fan assembly to a panel using resilient legs and spring members, allowing for easy installation and preventing vibrational noise. The document concludes by stating that modifications can be made to the system without departing from the spirit of the invention. </summary>

<summary>Spacecraft structures require lightweight composite materials, but lack inherent damping, leading to high vibration levels that can compromise functionality. Conventional kinematic mounts have limited success in reducing vibration. The present invention introduces kinematic mounts with novel damping features to dissipate flight loads and protect instruments. The mounts incorporate passive energy dissipating mechanisms and use six identical strut elements to reduce manufacturing complexity. By introducing vibration damping materials into the mounts, the suspension modes are damped, reducing vibration energy and improving performance. The design modifications preserve strength, stiffness, and kinematic features while significantly increasing damping levels. Overall, the damped kinematic mounts provide a solution to protect instruments from damaging flight loads and improve performance.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method involves compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and feeding it back into the pipeline at a lower exit temperature and increased exit pressure. The invention aims to reduce investments and operational risks associated with conventional re-cooling plants. By compressing the gas to an excess pressure, cooling it, and then expanding it to the desired exit pressure, the method achieves the required temperature reduction for re-entry into the pipeline. The compressor station includes compressors, heat exchangers, valve-controlled pipelines, and an electronic control system. The method allows for efficient operation throughout the year, with different configurations for summer and winter operation. The invention provides cost-effective cooling solutions and reduces the risk of accidents associated with traditional re-cooling units.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a clutch unit for large power transmission requirements, particularly in aircraft catapult systems. The clutch unit features interleaved clutch plates and discs, separate piston and cylinder means for each disc segment, and auxiliary fluid supply for cooling and retracting the clutch plates. The design allows for easy removal and replacement of clutch disc segments without disassembling the entire unit, providing improved torque control and minimizing residual drag. </summary>

<summary> The invention discloses a system of multiple cylinders, including combustion and expansion cylinders, designed to maximize thermal-to-mechanical efficiency and reduce heat loss. The system incorporates water injection, multiple cascading expansion cylinders, water cooling systems, water recovery systems, and catalytic materials to optimize energy extraction and reduce emissions. By capturing and transferring heat efficiently, the system aims to eliminate the need for a radiator and achieve high thermal-to-mechanical efficiencies.</summary>

<summary> The present invention is a SCADA system for remote control and navigation of a mobile structure that extracts energy from severe weather patterns. It incorporates algorithms to optimize efficiency by analyzing weather data and sensor inputs to adjust the operation of the structure. The system includes computer servers gathering data from GPS, weather satellites, and other sources, running software applications for remote human interaction and navigation planning. It can be applied to various mobile structures extracting energy from weather patterns, enabling unmanned operation in hazardous environments. The system also includes electromechanical circuits for controlling mechanisms affecting the structure's position and velocity. The GUI allows human operators to interact with the system, adjust control settings, monitor performance, and choose navigation paths based on cost or yield goals. Overall, the system provides a novel approach to remotely controlling and navigating energy-extracting vessels in challenging marine environments.</summary>

<summary> The invention concerns the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel for welding and heat treatment to achieve parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance. The method involves removing the metal alloy layer from the periphery of the plate before welding to prevent the formation of intermetallic areas that reduce deformability. Different methods of removing the metal layer, such as brushing or laser ablation, are described. After welding, the welded blanks undergo heat treatment to form an intermetallic alloy compound for corrosion protection. The method results in parts with satisfactory ductility, good corrosion resistance, and total elongation across the welded joint greater than or equal to 4%. The process is suitable for automotive industry applications, such as safety components for vehicles. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage made from at least two flat material ring segments joined and welded together. This reduces cutting waste and production costs. The ring segments are punched out from sheet metal material and can be formed as 120° segments. The method involves welding the segments together before forming the axial profiling. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields using two sensors and a digital processor. The system combines output signals from the sensors to create virtual sensor signals representing the amplitude of the interfering field at the object's location. Control loops process the virtual sensor signals to generate control signals for coils that generate compensation fields. The system can compensate for both homogeneous and inhomogeneous fields, and can simulate measuring fields at the object's location. Feedback effects between two systems operating in close proximity are accounted for using a feedback matrix. </summary>

<summary> The present methods and systems focus on using global satellite positioning to facilitate processing and transmission of information associated with telecommunications service locations. Efficient customer service is crucial in the telecommunications industry to maintain market share. Obtaining latitude and longitude coordinates of customer service locations is essential for accurate identification and quick response times. The system includes an input device for service technicians, a technician server, a GPS system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer records system. The GPS system tracks service technicians and obtains coordinates of customer service locations. The system also includes a mapping system for routing travel between multiple service locations. The mapping system generates driving directions based on the coordinates of the origin and destination locations. Computer-readable media embodiments are provided for these methods and systems. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample using CARS microscopy, where a resonance signal is generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering. The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site by a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with a reaction partner. Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes. The method allows for the introduction of resonance sites into a sample that does not inherently possess them, improving specificity and increasing the scattering cross section. By coupling intrinsic structures of the sample with reaction partners, resonance sites can be generated for detection in CARS microscopy. </summary>

<summary> The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from different sources in radiation therapy, comparing volume models to identify missing or extra elements, and using custom metric methods to evaluate conformance. The system can be used for training clinicians, evaluating autosegmentation programs, and assessing new treatment plans based on changes in patient anatomy during radiation therapy. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to accelerating the effective subtraction operation in floating point operations by calculating a subset difference in operand exponent arguments. This subset difference allows for the initiation of the subtraction of operand fractions before the complete difference between exponent arguments is determined. By selecting the subset carefully, the correct resulting fraction can be obtained even if the current procedure is incorrect. The apparatus implementing this technique includes logic units for detecting subset differences, selecting procedures, and determining final fraction results based on the differences in exponent arguments. This acceleration technique reduces the time required to execute floating point operations. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device for golfers, utilizing GPS and voice recognition technology. The device provides distance and other information verbally to the user. It can be incorporated into headgear, such as a hat, and uses a bone conductance vibration sensor for voice input. The device can also store and analyze user data to provide strategic recommendations for golf shots. Additionally, it can be used for other applications like hiking and hunting. The device may include Bluetooth technology for data transfer and audio communication purposes. Overall, the device offers a unique and convenient way for golfers to access course information and improve their game. </summary>

<summary> The present invention provides a system and method for accurately checking design rules for different types of circuits, such as memory and logic, in an integrated circuit design. By creating customized design rules based on modifying standard logic rules, false errors caused by checking regions not subject to the same rules are eliminated. The system categorizes errors for different regions, such as logic, different types of memory, and ROM, to pinpoint real design rule errors. The method involves running design rule checks on memory bit cell data against standard logic rules to create customized memory rules. This approach ensures that the right set of rules is applied to the right regions in the mask pattern data, improving accuracy and efficiency in the design verification process. The invention can be applied to various industries beyond semiconductor design, benefiting from the accurate and reliable design rule checking process.</summary>

<summary>Waveguide holograms are used for controlled illumination of objects with specific requirements, such as holograms and spatial light modulators, providing high diffraction efficiencies and compact, rugged arrangements. Various methods are employed to address challenges such as alignment sensitivity, nonuniformity of diffracted wavefronts, and two-sidedness, with different recording configurations and compensatory techniques utilized.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method of tracking specimens collected from patients in a medical facility using unique machine-readable codes on patient ID bands, order forms, specimen containers, and blood drawer badges. The method involves storing these codes in a computer database, ensuring that the patient and order codes are related, and tracking the specimen collection process in real-time. The system aims to reduce mislabeling errors and improve the efficiency of specimen collection in hospitals. The unique barcode numbers encode patient information, order details, and specimen container data, allowing for accurate tracking and processing of specimens. The system includes an electronic reading means, such as a barcode scanner, to input the barcode numbers into the computer for storage and relational linking. Overall, the method provides a failsafe process for identifying and processing patient specimen samples with zero defects. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to testing squirrel cage rotors for induction motors to detect defects. The apparatus includes a test head with exciting means, voltage sensing means, current sensing means, and processing means. The method involves magnetizing the rotor, sensing induced voltages, and determining resistance, reactance, and effective skew. The test head structure includes primary windings, voltage pick-up coils, and skew pick-up coils. The data acquisition and processing system calculates resistance, reactance, skew, dissymmetry, and skew dissymmetry. Statistical information is stored for analysis, and pass/fail determinations are made based on predetermined threshold values. The dual fixture system allows for efficient testing and control of multiple rotors with a single processing system.</summary>

<summary> The document describes a method for securing a mobile device by allowing managed libraries access to native resources while denying managed applications access. The process involves validating digital certificates associated with the managed libraries and applications. The manager authorizes requests from managed applications to access native resources through managed libraries. The runtime host is used to access the native system resources based on the authorization. The document also discusses verifying managed metadata, executing title players, and transmitting digitally signed containers to mobile devices. Lastly, the process includes validating headers, determining managed dependencies, and ensuring type-safe code in the executables. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between protective layers. Traditional smart cards are rigid and prone to damage, but this invention uses flexible materials to protect the electronic components. The process involves pre-shrinking core and bottom layers, printing indicia, attaching the antenna and chip, and laminating the layers together. The resulting card is durable, easy to manufacture, and provides improved protection for the electronic components. Various embodiments and methods are described to personalize the cards and add security features. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue in a memory, specifically in a functional memory. The queue is maintained using a tree-shaped structure where nodes have a maximum size and additions are directed to non-full nodes. Updates are made by copying the path from the root to the update point. A header node is added for faster and more space-efficient updates. A bit in the header node indicates the direction of the queue, allowing for easy inversion. The memory arrangement includes control logic, intermediate registers, and flag registers to manage the queue. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to embedded EPROM devices manufactured using existing IC technologies, such as DRAM technology. By utilizing DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors, EPROM devices can be built on the same wafer as DRAM devices without additional cost. The EPROM devices of the present invention have higher gate coupling ratios, reducing operation voltages and simplifying supporting circuits. Additionally, the invention introduces stress effect programmable read only memory (SEPROM) devices, which store data by utilizing transistor damages caused by electrical stresses. SEPROM devices offer advantages such as low cost, high data storage capacity, and security features for embedded applications.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to determining the optimum feedback gain for feedback control systems. Feedback control involves detecting errors, calculating correction amounts, and adjusting control parameters. The method involves provisionally determining feedback gains, executing feedback control, detecting errors, calculating evaluation values, and adjusting feedback gains. Evaluation functions are used to determine the optimum values of the P, I, and D gains. The method can be applied to various control systems, such as automatic guidance vehicles. The process can be executed in steps or continuously while the system is in operation. The method provides a quick and accurate way to determine feedback gains for optimal control performance.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range. The zoom lens design aims to balance the need for high relative aperture with the requirement of reducing bulk and size. Specific conditions and constructions for the fourth and fifth lens units are outlined to achieve optimal aberration correction. Four numerical examples of specific zoom lenses are provided, showcasing the effectiveness of the design in reducing the total length of the lens system while maintaining high optical performance. Overall, the invention represents a significant advancement in achieving compact, high-performance zoom lenses for photographic and video cameras. </summary>

<summary> The invention is an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches. The apparatus includes an enclosure with stationary and movable rings, a torque motor connected to a splined hub for rotating the driven disc assembly, and sensors for measuring distances and rotation. The program executed by a microprocessor controls the operation of the torque motor and servo motor to test the driven disc assembly for warpage. If the assembly is within specified tolerances, the apparatus allows for easy removal and installation of the next assembly. If the assembly is defective, the apparatus alerts the operator and stops further movement. The apparatus provides automatic testing, external indications of test results, and potential for statistical process control. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles in a detector, allowing for the detection of individual particles and integration of signals without prior knowledge of signal rates. The method involves discharging charge pulses on the low-voltage side of the detector and amplifying individual signals in a fast amplifier while integrating signals in a slow amplifier. By using a support capacitor and appropriate signal separation elements, the device enables reliable detection and evaluation of small-size signals. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to face age-estimation using a contourlet appearance model algorithm. The invention addresses the challenges of accurately estimating age from facial images. The method involves extracting facial features, mapping them to age groups, and using support vector regression for age estimation. The system includes a training phase with a database of landmarked faces and an age classifier. The system then classifies faces as youth or adult and applies appropriate aging functions for age estimation. The system can provide estimated ages with confidence factors and may be implemented on a computing system with various components. The invention allows for accurate and efficient face age-estimation in various applications.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for a motor vehicle security system with a removable payment element for cashless transactions. The payment element can be securely stored in the transmitter, allowing communication with the security system in both normal and secure states. A closure seals the receptacle when the payment element is removed, preventing disruptions and unauthorized use. </summary>

<summary> An imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, may go into a sleep mode to save energy when inactive for a long period. The tribo charge of toner in the device may decrease during inactivity, affecting image quality. Various methods and systems are disclosed to adjust the toner charge based on inactivity periods, user patterns, and sensor measurements to ensure consistent image quality. These methods can be implemented in software or hardware to optimize toner charging in imaging devices. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, preserving the definition of the image with higher resolution. The device consists of a matrix of pixels organized in arrangements, with some pixels dedicated to the first image and others to the second image. Different arrangements of pixels can be used, such as squares of four pixels, with each pixel emitting a specific color. The controller of the device can apply attenuation functions to adjust the light intensity signals for optimal display. The device can be used for various applications, such as combining images from different sensors or displaying graphical and textual information simultaneously. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus capable of controlling bias currents for MR heads and recording currents for recording heads with high precision using a single control line. The invention allows for independent regulation of bias currents for MR heads and recording currents for recording heads mounted on a rotary drum, ensuring stable data recording and reproduction. </summary>

<summary> The invention is an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to allow hands-free automatic answering and communication. It includes a timer for controlling the length of time of the call and a bypass switch to extend the call duration. The device can be used in various settings, such as for the physically handicapped or in business environments, and can be easily connected to existing telephone systems. The invention can operate in regular mode or automatic mode, answering incoming calls and connecting them to a speaker phone for two-way communication. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, especially when a second object is nearby. Traditional methods involve passive magnetic locators for ferrous objects and active transmitters for non-ferrous objects. The invention introduces a system with a transmitter and receiver that induce distinguishable currents in adjacent objects, making it easier to locate and trace a specific object. By using different carrier frequencies or modulation techniques, the system can produce output signals dependent on the presence of both currents. The transmitter's optimal positioning relative to the objects enhances the accuracy of tracing, even in the presence of adjacent objects. The system's performance is further improved by the inverse cube relationship between horizontal separation and depth of the objects. Overall, the invention provides a more efficient and accurate method for locating and tracing concealed conductive objects in challenging environments.</summary>

<summary> The present invention is a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by using remotely pumped optical amplifiers powered by branch cables. The network consists of a ring topology optical fiber cable trunk with telecommunications hubs and branching units serially interconnected. Light emitting power sources are used to provide energy for optical amplifiers located in the trunk and branches. The system allows for signal amplification without the need for conventional optical repeaters, reducing costs and improving network reliability. Branch assemblies serve as add/drop points for telecommunications signals, with branch fiber optic cables transmitting both communications signals and optical energy. The combination of trunk and branch structures with remote pumping of optical energy provides strong network survivability and flexibility in undersea communications systems. The invention can be applied to other signal multiplexing methods and terrestrial communication systems, offering a cost-effective and efficient solution for network design and optimization.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to cover plate devices for wiring devices in ganged boxes mounted in building walls, providing a finished look without exposed fasteners. The prior art involved using screws to attach cover plates, resulting in unsightly exposed screws and potential shock hazards. The present invention consists of a two-part device - an attachment member and a cover plate member. The cover plate member has no visible fasteners, is easily installed and removed, and can accommodate walls that are not flat or even. The device is designed to cover one or multiple wiring devices, with the cover plate engaging the attachment plate using latching pawls and saw-tooth shaped racks. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for screens, such as television sets and monitors. The device consists of concentric annular strips that can be fixed in front of a screen and slide over each other to cover or uncover the screen. The strips have hook and locking elements for reliable folding and unfolding. An adapter member provides a flat attachment face for the device, allowing it to be easily fitted to various types of monitors. The strips may be solid or made from plate material, with integrated hook or locking elements. The invention provides a compact, inexpensive, and reliable solution for reducing glare on screens. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to automatically providing an indication to a speaker when their rate of speech exceeds a listener's comprehension rate. The invention addresses the challenge of understanding a native language when it is not the listener's primary language. It automatically detects situations where a speaking rate is too rapid for a listener and notifies the speaker to slow down. The device includes components such as a microphone, sensory mechanism, speaking rate processor, and comprehension comparator. The method involves identifying the discourse, determining the language being spoken, setting a speaking rate threshold, and notifying the speaker to decrease their rate if it exceeds the threshold. The invention can be implemented in hardware, software, or a combination of both, and can be embedded in a computer program product. The scope of the invention is defined by the following claims.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call, using a multimedia server with blender software. Incoming calls are directed to the blender, which initiates voice and multimedia components, passing the voice component back to the telephony server with an indication to prevent looping. Outgoing calls are similarly processed, with the blender managing the signaling paths and allowing the multimedia server to control the bearer paths. The methodology involves SIP protocols for call setup and tear down, with the option to integrate with an Intelligent Network for call disposition handling. Modifications and improvements to the embodiments are within the scope of the invention. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a device for optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, allowing for higher picture sequence frequency. It involves means for deviating and suppressing the beam to scan successively over N lines of a picture plane. A cyclic line counter counts line pulses and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses. A sawtooth generator controls the vertical deviation of the beam. The device offers a flexible way to record rapid processes with high resolution in time. By adjusting the counting capacity of the counter, the time resolution can be optimized for different processes. The device can be used for digital analysis and storage of video signals for later interpretation. It provides a cost-effective alternative to high-speed cameras for recording rapidly changing phenomena. The device can also be used for recording IR, UV, or X-ray pictures. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework for connected devices, allowing for dynamic synchronization based on device context and attributes. The framework involves a central reference point server processing synchronization requests, constructing response bundles, and prioritizing file downloads for efficient synchronization. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a foil electron multiplier designed for electron multiplication by transmission, using a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to amplify electrons in discrete stages. The foil electron multiplier has advantages over conventional electron multipliers, such as higher gain efficiency, simplicity of fabrication, lower cost, ability to cover larger areas, and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback. Experimental results demonstrate that the foil electron multiplier performs as described in equations and has a higher gain efficiency than conventional electron multipliers. </summary>

<summary> The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention allows almost any motion picture to be viewed effortlessly with a 3-dimensional visual effect. It uses signals to synchronize the lens filters to the lateral motion in the motion picture, controlling the 3-dimensional visual effect for the viewer in real-time. The system does not require any alteration to the motion picture or any control information placed in the motion picture. The lenses of the viewer glasses can be controlled to be clear-clear, clear-dark, or dark-clear based on the identification of synchronization events. The algorithm used in the system detects vertical edges in the frames to determine the direction of lateral motion and adjust the lenses accordingly. The system can account for head movement and adjust the lenses accordingly. Different lens control algorithms may be used for different types of motion or media formats. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die from the wafer without a wafer saw. The process involves forming trenches along scribe lines on the wafer, applying mechanical pressure to cause a clean break along the trenches, and singulating the die. The method includes steps such as applying a photo resist layer, patterning the layer, etching trenches, back-grinding the wafer if necessary, applying adhesive tape, and applying pressure to the back surface of the wafer. The pressure can be applied in the X and Y directions or in a circular motion to break the wafer along the scribe lines. A ring may be used to hold the wafer in place during singulation. The process is efficient, reduces chipping, and eliminates the need for a wafer saw. </summary>

<summary> The present invention provides a system and method for allowing finders of lost objects to anonymously communicate with owners through a unique ID and virtual locale, facilitating the return of lost items. Owners register their contact information and tag IDs, while finders can access open cases, send messages, and open new cases through the system. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure to prevent damage to field emission elements. Field emission devices have advantages over LCDs but are prone to damage from ionized gases. The protection structure includes reduction plates or electrodes on the cathode to deflect ionized gases away. The reduction plates can be elongated and parallel to field emission elements or arranged in a meshwork pattern. A negative bias voltage is applied to the reduction plates to prevent ion-induced electrical surges. The protection structure prolongs the lifetime of the field emission elements and can be fabricated using conventional deposition and etching techniques. The scope of the invention is defined by the appended claims. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes, allowing for recording information through an edge surface of the sensor. The sensor includes a semiconductor substrate with image sensor elements on the top surface and two edge surfaces. Charge carriers generated by light on the edge surfaces are guided towards the image sensor elements by doped layers, enabling imaging in multiple planes. The sensor can be used for various applications, including simultaneous imaging of different surfaces or color scanning with color filters. The design of the sensor allows for improved charge collection and reduced crosstalk, making it versatile and efficient for different imaging needs. </summary>

<summary> The invention provides methods for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device in a home network, allowing for power management and optimization of network performance. By transferring the administrative functions, the total power consumption of the home network can be minimized while ensuring optimal network administration and functionality. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to using antenna elements to measure the direction of electromagnetic radiation propagation. A unique equi-spaced triplet arrangement of antenna elements was identified to optimize angle measurements. The arrangement allows for unambiguous angle measurements up to about 7 degrees. The system uses radio interferometric techniques and signal processing circuits to determine the elevation angle of radio waves arriving from a remote source. The array can operate in receive or transmit mode, with coherent carriers required for transmissions within each triplet. The system can be used for applications such as monitoring aircraft height during landings. Various circuit arrangements can be used to measure the quotient signal representing the elevation angle. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a seal supported subminiature lamp assembly using a high temperature polymer to create a liquid tight seal around the glass envelope. The polymer provides extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack. The assembly eliminates the use of adhesive, provides a longer bulb life, and protects against burns for users. The polymeric seal support forms a housing around the glass envelope and base, while potting material can be added underneath the glass envelope for stability. The assembly can be used in various applications where insulation, heat resistance, and effective sealing are required. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to precoder configuration in multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) communications systems, specifically focusing on a Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) based precoder. Various precoding techniques are discussed, including Block Diagonalization (BD) and Tomlinson-Harashima Precoding (THP). The proposed method for configuring a GDFE Precoder reduces computational costs without sacrificing system capacity. The method involves computing filter matrices C, transmit filter matrix B, feedforward filter matrix F, and interference pre-cancellation matrix G. Numerical examples demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method in improving spectral efficiency of MU-MIMO systems. The methods can be implemented in software executed by digital signal processors for high-speed digital communication systems.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel that can display images in different colors without using an intermediate electrode. The panel includes a first luminescent layer emitting green light and a second luminescent layer emitting orange light, allowing for the display of green, lemon, or yellow colors. By adjusting the driving voltage, the panel can display different colors with varying color purity. The panel can be used in applications such as automobile instrument panels, providing comfortable and high-luminance displays in different lighting conditions. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device with an axial fan and a housing designed to increase intake airflow rate without modifying assembly conditions. The fan housing extends outward to enlarge the intake airflow area, allowing for enhanced heat-dissipating performance. The design includes an impeller and a housing with a passage for guiding air streams, with the sidewall extending radially outwards to enlarge intake or discharge areas. The housing design allows for increased airflow rate and improved heat-dissipating efficiency, especially when combined with a heat sink. The heat-dissipating device can be mounted in a system casing to dissipate heat generated by electrical elements. The design also includes inclined portions in the housing to guide air streams towards the center of the heat sink for optimal heat dissipation. Overall, the invention provides a more efficient and effective heat-dissipating solution for electrical products. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, providing a low-cost alternative to traditional telephony. The terminal establishes a wireless connection to a connecting unit, which connects to the Internet or network. A service server manages connections between users, providing additional services like news, music, and chat rooms. The terminal can be an earphone or headset, offering hands-free communication in a compact design.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method for fabricating a structure for semiconductor circuitry using a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on a semiconductor substrate, followed by the deposition of a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide. The use of a germanium buffer layer on the semiconductor substrate helps prevent the formation of a low dielectric constant layer and allows for the epitaxial growth of high dielectric constant oxides. The integration of oxides on GaAs is also simplified by using a Ge buffer layer. The structure can be further enhanced by adding additional buffer layers and top electrodes for stability and improved properties. Overall, the method provides a solution to the challenges of integrating high dielectric constant oxides with semiconductor materials. </summary>

<summary>Receiver input circuits in radio and television receivers typically consist of preamplifier and mixer arrangements connected by adjustable selection means, with amplification controlled based on signal input. The use of amplification control circuits, such as PIN diode networks, helps protect components from signal distortions caused by strong signals. By incorporating multiple amplification control loops with varying response thresholds and frequency bandwidths, the circuit can effectively prevent overloading and distortion. The control signal for these loops is derived from the intermediate frequency signal and supplied to different parts of the circuit, allowing for precise control and protection against interference. Additional features, such as extended reactance networks and tunable selective circuits, further enhance the selectivity and performance of the receiver input circuit.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to using a recessed mask structure to prevent high electrical fields in small semiconductor devices, reducing leakage and breakdown. By positioning the mask below the surface, the structure achieves lower capacitance and faster signal propagation in interconnect wiring. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to optimizing the visual impact of advertising clips inserted into video sequences by considering the regions of interest in both the video sequence and the advertising clip. A method is proposed where salience maps are generated for the video sequence and each advertising clip, and the clip with the highest degree of similarity to the video sequence is selected for insertion. Different methods for determining similarity, such as correlation coefficients or Euclidean distances, can be used. The selected advertising clip is then inserted at a predefined insertion point, such as a shot change in the video sequence. A device for implementing this method includes memory, a processing unit, and input/output interfaces to handle the processing of video sequences and advertising clips.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to network implemented shared workspace environments, allowing for spontaneous setup of collaborative work-sharing environments between physically distant individuals. Examples of collaborative work-share environments include video conferencing, document sharing, and shared whiteboard systems. PC-based products have been introduced as more economical alternatives to expensive dedicated equipment for video conferencing. However, current PC-based systems are difficult to use and involve cumbersome setup processes. The present invention provides a system for initiating a collaborative work-share environment between parties to a telephone call without complex setup processes. The system includes a collaborate indicator and button on the telephone set, allowing users to share information, conduct video conferences, and more while maintaining their voice connection. The system can be implemented over a LAN or the Internet, and can be extended to multiparty collaboration.
